quality_assessment: Chapter is exceptionally comprehensive and accurate. All CLI syntax has been verified against features.json and is current. The chapter includes excellent coverage of all major features with practical, copy-paste ready examples. Only very minor clarity improvements possible.

issues.section: Analyzing Rust Projects - Basic Rust Analysis (lines 38-50)
issues.description: Example shows both 'debtmap analyze' and 'debtmap analyze .' but doesn't explicitly state they're equivalent since path defaults to current directory
issues.current_content:
# Analyze current directory
debtmap analyze

# Analyze current directory (explicit)
debtmap analyze .
issues.should_be: Add clarifying comment that both are identical
issues.fix_suggestion: Add comment: '# Analyze current directory (path defaults to '.')' for the first example

issues.description: The dual use of 'format' terminology (--format for output type, --output-format for JSON variant) could be slightly clearer
issues.current_content:
# Output format options: terminal, json, markdown
debtmap analyze . --format terminal
issues.should_be: Add brief note explaining the difference between --format and --output-format
issues.fix_suggestion: Add note above examples: 'Note: --format selects output type (json/markdown/terminal), while --output-format selects JSON structure variant (unified/legacy)'

positive_aspects: Exceptionally comprehensive coverage - all major CLI options documented with examples
All CLI syntax verified as accurate against features.json (analyze, validate, compare, init commands)

Outstanding real-world examples from Debtmap's own CI/CD workflows

validate-improvement command not documented (but this is actually in a separate chapter)
improvement_suggestions: Consider adding 'Quick Reference Card' at the top with the 10 most common command patterns
Add small note clarifying --format vs --output-format distinction earlier in chapter
Consider adding timing expectations for various options (e.g., 'multi-pass adds ~30% time')
Add examples of chaining commands in workflows (analyze → compare → validate cycle)
Include environment variable usage examples (DEBTMAP_CACHE_DIR, etc.)
Add section on interpreting exit codes for CI script decision-making
Consider adding visual workflow diagrams showing analysis pipeline
Add more jq examples for advanced JSON processing
Include performance benchmarks for different project sizes
Add troubleshooting callouts within sections (not just at end)
Consider adding terminal output screenshots showing actual colored output
Add examples of .debtmap.toml for popular frameworks (actix-web, Django, Express)

topics_covered: CI integration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI)
Dead code and public API analysis
God object detection with purity weighting
metadata.validation_focus: Ensure examples use current CLI syntax and options
metadata.notes: This is one of the highest quality documentation chapters. All advanced features from features.json are documented with clear examples. CLI syntax is 100% accurate. Only extremely minor clarity improvements possible.
